member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Document.FromPlainText(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a document from a plain text string and optional language.
member.param: The text of the document. Must not be null.
The language of the document, as an ISO or BCP-47 language code. This may be empty or null (the default), in which case the language will be detected by the Natural Language service.
member.returns: The newly created document.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Document.FromHtml(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a document from an HTML string and optional language.
member.param: The HTML text of the document. Must not be null.
The language of the document, as an ISO or BCP-47 language code. This may be empty or null (the default), in which case the language will be detected by the Natural Language service.
member.returns: The newly created document.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Document.Type
member.summary: Required. If the type is not set or is `TYPE_UNSPECIFIED`, returns an `INVALID_ARGUMENT` error.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Document.Content
member.summary: The content of the input in string format. Cloud audit logging exempt since it is based on user data.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Document.GcsContentUri
member.summary: The Google Cloud Storage URI where the file content is located. This URI must be of the form: gs://bucket_name/object_name. For more details, see https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/reference-uris. NOTE: Cloud Storage object versioning is not supported.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Document.Language
member.summary:
The language of the document (if not specified, the language is automatically detected). Both ISO and BCP-47 language codes are accepted.
[Language Support](/natural-language/docs/languages) lists currently supported languages for each API method. If the language (either specified by the caller or automatically detected) is not supported by the called API method, an `INVALID_ARGUMENT` error is returned.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.LanguageServiceReflection
member.summary: Holder for reflection information generated from google/cloud/language/v1/language_service.proto

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.EncodingType
member.summary: Represents the text encoding that the caller uses to process the output. Providing an `EncodingType` is recommended because the API provides the beginning offsets for various outputs, such as tokens and mentions, and languages that natively use different text encodings may access offsets differently.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.EncodingType.None
member.summary: If `EncodingType` is not specified, encoding-dependent information (such as `begin_offset`) will be set at `-1`.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.EncodingType.Utf8
member.summary: Encoding-dependent information (such as `begin_offset`) is calculated based on the UTF-8 encoding of the input. C++ and Go are examples of languages that use this encoding natively.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.EncodingType.Utf16
member.summary: Encoding-dependent information (such as `begin_offset`) is calculated based on the UTF-16 encoding of the input. Java and JavaScript are examples of languages that use this encoding natively.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.EncodingType.Utf32
member.summary: Encoding-dependent information (such as `begin_offset`) is calculated based on the UTF-32 encoding of the input. Python is an example of a language that uses this encoding natively.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Sentence
member.summary: Represents a sentence in the input document.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Sentence.Sentiment
member.summary: For calls to [AnalyzeSentiment][] or if [AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_document_sentiment][google.cloud.language.v1.AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_document_sentiment] is set to true, this field will contain the sentiment for the sentence.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Entity
member.summary: Represents a phrase in the text that is a known entity, such as a person, an organization, or location. The API associates information, such as salience and mentions, with entities.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Entity.Name
member.summary: The representative name for the entity.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Entity.Metadata
member.summary:
Metadata associated with the entity.
For most entity types, the metadata is a Wikipedia URL (`wikipedia_url`) and Knowledge Graph MID (`mid`), if they are available. For the metadata associated with other entity types, see the Type table below.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Entity.Salience
member.summary:
The salience score associated with the entity in the [0, 1.0] range.
The salience score for an entity provides information about the importance or centrality of that entity to the entire document text. Scores closer to 0 are less salient, while scores closer to 1.0 are highly salient.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Entity.Mentions
member.summary: The mentions of this entity in the input document. The API currently supports proper noun mentions.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Entity.Sentiment
member.summary: For calls to [AnalyzeEntitySentiment][] or if [AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_entity_sentiment][google.cloud.language.v1.AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_entity_sentiment] is set to true, this field will contain the aggregate sentiment expressed for this entity in the provided document.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Entity.Types
member.summary: Container for nested types declared in the Entity message type.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Entity.Types.Type
member.summary: The type of the entity. For most entity types, the associated metadata is a Wikipedia URL (`wikipedia_url`) and Knowledge Graph MID (`mid`). The table below lists the associated fields for entities that have different metadata.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Entity.Types.Type.PhoneNumber
member.summary:
Phone number

The metadata lists the phone number, formatted according to local convention, plus whichever additional elements appear in the text:
  • number – the actual number, broken down into sections as per local convention
  • national_prefix – country code, if detected
  • area_code – region or area code, if detected
  • extension – phone extension (to be dialed after connection), if detected

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Entity.Types.Type.Address
member.summary:
Address

The metadata identifies the street number and locality plus whichever additional elements appear in the text:
  • street_number – street number
  • locality – city or town
  • street_name – street/route name, if detected
  • postal_code – postal code, if detected
  • country – country, if detected
  • broad_region – administrative area, such as the state, if detected
  • narrow_region – smaller administrative area, such as county, if detected
  • sublocality – used in Asian addresses to demark a district within a city, if detected

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Entity.Types.Type.Date
member.summary:
Date

The metadata identifies the components of the date:
  • year – four digit year, if detected
  • month – two digit month number, if detected
  • day – two digit day number, if detected

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Entity.Types.Type.Number
member.summary:
Number

The metadata is the number itself.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Entity.Types.Type.Price
member.summary:
Price

The metadata identifies the value and currency.
